content: Chris Harrison | Welcome Chris Harrison Research Curriculum Vitae Fun Projects Travel I'm an Associate Professor of Human-Computer Interaction at Carnegie Mellon University, directing the Future Interfaces Group. My research group creates new sensing and interface technologies that open new modes of interaction between humans and computers. These efforts often lie in emerging use domains, such as smart environments, wearable computing, and augmented reality. Please see my research page for more details. My idea of the good life is one of education, adventure, and creativity.
